item.description:
Lecture:  Grenier Army Airfield During World War II

Saturday, February 16, 2013

10:30 a.m.-12:00 p.m.

In the Millyard Museum

$10 general public, FREE to members of the Manchester Historic Association

Please RSVP for this event on the Manchester History Network Meetup website.

Manchester Airport became Grenier Army Airfield in 1941 and would be a hub of activity throughout the war, bringing soldiers from all over the country to Manchester. Bob Skadberg will share the exciting story of Grenier Army Airfield during World War II. Skadberg is recent Masters Degree graduate of the University of New Hampshire, majoring in Museum Studies. He completed an internship with the Manchester Historic Association in December 2012, and is retired from the U.S. Army.
item.how_to_find_us: Check at the front desk at the library
item.name: Lecture: Grenier Army Airfield During World War II
